message.content:
To align a row of divs to the right using Flexbox in CSS, you can use the `justify-content` property with the value `flex-end`. Here's an example: CSS Code: ```css .container { display: flex; justify-content: flex-end; } .div-item { margin: 10px; /* optional, for spacing between divs */ padding: 20px; /* optional, for content inside the div */ border: 1px solid #ddd; /* optional, for borders around divs */ } ``` HTML Code: ```html
Div 1
Div 2
``` In the above code, we have created a container with `display: flex;` property and the child divs are placed in this container. The `justify-content: flex-end;` property aligns all the divs to the right side of the parent container. You can add more content inside each div or adjust the margin, padding, and border properties as per your needs.
